message: Reverting to content that is supportable notwithstanding Wisestunt.
deleted what seems not relevant to the matter

GlacierWidth is incorrect in believing without proof that the true and relevant edits are being done by the subject. The subject has a wide body of colleagues and former students who are determined to thwart GlacierWidth's obvious efforts to malign the subject. Bring it on Glacierwidth.  Everything you have tried to suppress has now been substantiated with references.  Your persistence is verging on outing the anonymous complainant.
A more descriptive account of the subject.
The Shoet description provided by GlacierWidth was not representative of the subject's work which includes malaria, HIV, tuberculosis, a wide range of annelids that are not leeches, and so on.
Glacierwidth is introducing bias into this article. Edits are reflective of that.

/* Research */  editor Glacierwidth intentionally left out the complete sentence in which Burreson stated that Siddall had mellowed on that (this was from 2002).  Out of context quotations intended to malign are not permissible.  Provide the whole sentence or none at all.
Prior edits with this information lacked citations. Those citations are now included.
Prior edits with this information lacked citations. Those citations are now included.

Undid revision 1020620417 by [[Special:Contributions/Drmies|Drmies]] ([[User talk:Drmies|talk]])  There is an earlier version of this table that seems to have had the references improperly set as hyperlinks which a a bot removed. Restoring the table in order to next restore the links as references.
/* Career */ better describes this as Siddall's statement, not as fact

/* Career */ The use of Internet Archive was challenged by a prior editor, however it is proper and allowed.  The inclusion of items published by the subject of a living person biography is allowed on Neil de Grasse Tyson's  Wikipedia page for his facebook statement in his own defence Facebook post, and for Tony Robbins' self-published Medium blog on his Wikipedia page.  I see no reason to disallow Siddall's public statements.

/* Research */ The section is relatively devoid of content.  It is also incorrect.  Phylogeny and Evolution would appear to be a minority of Siddall's contributions. The sentence (from 2002) about being a harsh critic of likelihood is also apparently intended to disparage as it left out the full sentence which stated that Siddall had mellowed on that (again that being some 2 decades ago).

/* Career */  This sentence is misleading.  Perkins and Siddall filed complaints against each other. Neither was harassment.  Neither was sexual.  Perkins was (as proven noted in earlier versions of this section) in a position of power over Siddall at the time. The sentence, as written leaves a defamatory impression that is not allowed in biographies of living persons.
/* Career */  Less biasedly represents the NY Times article.

Deleted text improperly describes the person and was without citation. Judging from his Google Scholar profile, a minority of his publications are on leeches, their systematics and evolutionary biology. Inserted text is more representative and is properly cited.
The statement is incorrect.  Siddall was not terminated for violating the museum's policies on sexual relationships.  And this is not what the New York Times article states.
Added content and links to Communicating Science section

Filling out details of Siddall's career

Alter: url, title, pages. URLs might have been anonymized. Add: hdl, pages, volume, journal, s2cid, issue, jstor, doi, archive-date, archive-url, authors 1-1. Removed parameters. Formatted [[WP:ENDASH|dashes]]. Some additions/deletions were parameter name changes. | [[WP:UCB|Use this bot]]. [[WP:DBUG|Report bugs]]. | Suggested by Abductive | via #UCB_webform 369/1110

Removing irrelevant details and details which are inappropriately supported by only auxiliary sources (a source written by the article's subject). Added a flag that the article appears to be the target of edit's by the article's subject.
This has ben edited to remove redundant information and improve readability.
